messages.subject: My curse is broken!
messages.msgSnippet: No, its not that menopause is over (damn it). And I don t really believe in the power of curses, but sometimes in the intent is clear. A couple of years ago,
messages.messageBody:
No, its not that menopause is over (damn it).
And I don't really believe in the power of curses, but sometimes in
the intent is clear.


A couple of years ago, someone on the Unschooling Discussion list was
asked repeatedly to remove an advertisement from a sigline.
she wrote to me on the side:

"You are closed minded and I truly hope karma smites you and yours."

There was more to it and I"m going to put it on a page and link it to
my feedback page, but today I got something very sweet, part of which
was

"May God bless you with health and happiness in bounty!"

Because the first one cursed me with karma (yeah, I know; it was the
"smiting" that was the curse), and the second one came from India, it
seems a good cancel-out action!

The second one is in full here:

http://sandradodd.com/feedback and has made my day way happier. (I
was never really feeling cursed nor in any danger of smiting, because
my family is doing so well. Kirby visited, and here are photos:
http://sandradodd.blogspot.com )



Sandra



Sandra











[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
